title: Non-obvious message on `create --force`
body:
I have no idea on how to make things better without breaking something, but I am reporting this here, because it has no happened often enough to be an issue. Whenever people are transitioning from using "just Git" to DataLad, I get asked what they should do to their existing repos. My answer is `datalad create --force`. But this leads to annex the following annex output for any repo that has a remote:
```
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp % datalad clone git@github.com:datalad-handbook/book.git
install(ok): /tmp/book (dataset)                                                             
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp % cd book
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp/book (git)-[master] % datalad create --force
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/book 
[INFO   ]   Unable to parse git config from origin 
[INFO   ]   Remote origin does not have git-annex installed; setting annex-ignore 
[INFO   ]   This could be a problem with the git-annex installation on the remote. Please make sure that git-annex-shell is available in PATH when you ssh into the remote. Once you have fixed the git-annex installation, run: git annex enableremote origin 
```

When I stand next to people the first time, I can explain and it is not a problem. Few weeks later I get an email asking me what they are doing wrong. The only "solution" I can come up with is to wrap this message into another one that explains the non-severity of the issue. But this would also increase the flood of information.

I think part of the confusion comes from the fact that `create --force` feels like a local operations, but `annex init` inside talks to remotes too.
